intro: Anethum foeniculoides, commonly known as wild fennel, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant features feathery, finely divided leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels. Its seeds are often used as a spice, similar to regular fennel, and have a distinct anise-like flavor. The plant is also valued for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to aid digestion and relieve respiratory issues.
